definition: gold/chemical element Au/generic term for lustrous and ductile metals/money/golden/highly respected/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]
dry measure for grain equal to ten dou 斗/ten pecks/one hundred liters
rock/stone/stone inscription/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]

sentences.english: He was also a famous book collector and epigrapher in Shantong area during Qian Long period.
sentences.chinese: 他也是乾隆朝山東著名的藏書家及金石學家。

sentences.english: This part explores the influence of Epigraphy of Qing Dynasty on the practice of calligraphy.
sentences.chinese: 第四部分，宏觀探討清代金石學對書法實踐的影響。

sentences.english: Epigraphy became a special discipline, and made great achievement in the Song Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 金石學在宋代成爲專門的學問，取得了很高的成就。

sentences.english: The Yuan and Ming Dynasty is a declining period in the course of the Epigraphy development.
sentences.chinese: 元明兩代是金石學發展過程中的相對衰退期。

sentences.english: Part IV. This part explores the influence of Epigraphy of Qing Dynasty on the practice of calligraphy.
sentences.chinese: 第四部分，宏觀探討清代金石學對書法實踐的影響。

sentences.english: The eighth edition incorporates the latest archaeological and epigraphic research.
sentences.chinese: 第八版採用了最新的考古和金石學研究。

definition: the Song dynasty (960-1279)/refers to the Northern (960-1127) and Southern Song (1128-1279)
to comment/a point by point commentary
to copy (a text) from person to person/(of a text) to be transmitted by copying
Ji Yun (1724-1805), Qing Dynasty writer, author of supernatural novel Notes on a Minutely Observed Thatched Hut 閱微草堂筆記|阅微草堂笔记
